text: The only way I could get past those stupid martial artist girls at the end of the level was to use my special move, die, then repeat. I could NEVER land a single hit!
author: Moop Bread

text: you let a woman beat you? damn...
author: Allen Livadic

text: The trick is to do a jump attack at them as they're coming down to the ground so they don't have time to run and jump again. It's pretty hard until you figure that out.
author: K.T.B.

text:
There was a special attack move, which was dealing kinda low damage, but always knocking\knockbacking enemy.
The trick is to look opposite way from enemy unit, then perform a leg strike with a key pressed.

Bosses don't react on this attack, so it's pretty easy to start beating them with combos, beginning from this attack move.
author: VVish

text: I had the same problems until a friend showed me the correct method to beat them - use ONLY your reverse attack (face away, hold b and press c). You should be able to defeat them without taking any damage provided you can avoid the jump kicks.
author: Enigma of the Absolute

text: The only way to beat em is You have to turn your back towards them they will try to attack but you gotta be faster than Mona & lisa

text: I just played this game for the first time on that Genesis Classic Game Console thing that has 80 games installed on it. I have to say that Streets of Rage's two sequels are much better.

text: well duh, it was the first game of its series.

text:
the sequels felt like games from a different franchise with the same characters.
SOR1 had a grounded Miami street police feel whereas the later ones felt way more rooted in a cartoon reality
